title: Understanding the 3D Coordinate System
desc: In 3D space, there are three axes:

funcs.title: rotateX(angle)
descs: Rotates an element around the X-axis.
Positive values tilt the top of the element backward, while negative values tilt it forward.

funcs.title: rotateY(angle)
descs: Rotates an element around the Y-axis.
Positive values rotate the right side backward, while negative values rotate it forward.

funcs.title: rotateZ(angle)
descs: Rotates an element around the Z-axis, which is similar to the standard 2D rotate() function.
Positive values rotate clockwise, negative values counterclockwise.

funcs.title: translateZ(length)
descs: Moves an element along the Z-axis, creating the illusion of moving closer to or farther from the viewer.
Positive values move the element closer, negative values move it farther.

funcs.title: translate3d(x, y, z)
descs: Moves an element in 3D space using X, Y, and Z coordinates.
Combines translateX(), translateY(), and translateZ() into one shorthand property.

funcs.title: scaleZ(factor)
funcs.desc: Scales an element along the Z-axis, affecting its depth.

funcs.title: scale3d(x, y, z)
funcs.desc: Scales an element in 3D space by specifying different scaling factors for the X, Y, and Z axes.

title: Perspective for 3D Effects
desc: The perspective property is crucial in 3D transforms. it determines how elements are viewed in 3D space. It gives the illusion of objects coming closer or moving away.

props.name: perspective
props.desc: Can be applied on the parent container to define the perspective for all child elements.

props.name: perspective-origin
props.desc: Specifies the point from which the viewer observes the 3D scene similar to transform-origin. By default, it's set to 50% 50% center.

title: Transform-Origin in 3D
desc: Controls the point from which the transformation is applied. For 3D transformations, this becomes more important as it defines the anchor point in 3D space.

title: Backface Visibility
desc: The backface-visibility property controls whether the back side of a 3D-transformed element is visible when it is rotated. By default, it is set to visible.

title: Combining 3D Transforms
desc: You can combine multiple 3D transform functions to create complex effects.
explain: This rotates the element on both the X and Y axes and moves it forward along the Z-axis.
